body_html:
@abenmao Thank you for your quick reply. But am still confused about the variable type.
According to the ref (https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/GraphKeys), the MODEL_VARIABLE is just a subset of GLOBAL_VARIABLE, and in such case, we can only use LOCAL_VARIABLE instead? Actually we only use the default setting of get_variable(), it's confused for us to capture the MODEL_VARIABLE exception.

According to the ref (https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/GraphKeys), the MODEL_VARIABLE is just a subset of GLOBAL_VARIABLE, and in such case, we can only use LOCAL_VARIABLE instead?  Actually we only use the default setting of get_variable(), it's confused for us to capture the MODEL_VARIABLE  exception.
body:
@abenmao Thank you for your quick reply. But am  still confused about the variable type.
According to the ref (https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/GraphKeys), the MODEL_VARIABLE is just a subset of GLOBAL_VARIABLE, and in such case, we can only use LOCAL_VARIABLE instead?  Actually we only use the default setting of get_variable(), it's confused for us to capture the MODEL_VARIABLE  exception.
